Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were assigned to either a driving pressure-guided ventilation group (ΔP group, n=31) or a standard PEEP ventilation group (N group, n=30).

Participants.evidence: This prospective observational study included 61 frail patients undergoing non-cardiac surgery (NCS)

Intervention.evidence: The ΔP group received individualized PEEP titrated to minimize driving pressure (plateau pressure minus PEEP), while the N group received a fixed PEEP of 5 cmH 2 O.

Objective.evidence: aimed to compare postoperative pulmonary outcomes between standard positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) ventilation and driving pressure-guided individualized ventilation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PPCs within 7 days.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Patients were assigned to either a driving pressure-guided ventilation group (ΔP group, n=31) or a standard PEEP ventilation group (N group, n=30).

Result_Outcome.evidence: No PPCs occurred in the ΔP group, whereas 7 patients (23.3%) in the N group developed PPCs (P<0.01).
